poem:
### The Shower Curtain

Each morning it waves—  
a faded wisp  
of ocean blue—no plastic,  
but fabric billows,  
soft against steam.  
  
Awake, half-seen,  
I pull it aside,  
revealing more than just water—  
a thin veil  
in morning light,  
gracefully guarding  
that fragile boundary  
between sleep and  
awakening.
